intro: Ferula nudicaulis, commonly known as the narrowleaf ferula, is a flowering plant native to the high mountain regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at elevations above 2,000 meters. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight hairy texture, while its roots can be aromatic and have been used in traditional medicine. Ferula nudicaulis is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
